title: Why did hospitals have these frogs in their supply rooms? - Carly Anne York

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason African clawed frogs were used in pregnancy testing for decades?

options.label: A
options.text: They were abundant in their native habitat.

options.label: B
options.text: They had a high tolerance for human urine.

options.label: C
options.text: They responded to the chorionic gonadotropin hormone (hCG) in a short amount of time.

options.label: D
options.text: They were easy to catch and export.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the hormone found in the urine of pregnant people that was detected using African clawed frogs?

options.label: A
options.text: Pituitary extract

options.label: B
options.text: Chorionic gonadotropin hormone (hCG)

options.label: C
options.text: Ox hormone

options.label: D
options.text: Frog hormone

multiple-choice.question: What was the surprising result when Lancelot Hogben injected African clawed frogs with a pituitary extract derived from an ox?

options.label: A
options.text: The frogs began to jump more frequently.

options.label: B
options.text: The frogs' camouflage ability improved.

options.label: C
options.text: The frogs began laying eggs without the presence of a male.

options.label: D
options.text: The frogs' skin turned a different color.

multiple-choice.question: In what year did the use of African clawed frogs in pregnancy testing begin to decline as chemical tests became more widely available?
What are some of the major concerns associated with the widespread use of African clawed frogs in laboratories?

options.label: A
options.text: Their ability to escape and outcompete native amphibians.

options.label: B
options.text: Their potential to transmit diseases to humans.

options.label: C
options.text: Their impact on the environment.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why African clawed frogs are now classified as an invasive species?

options.label: A
options.text: They were overhunted in the wild.

options.label: B
options.text: They were introduced to new habitats and outcompeted native species.

options.label: C
options.text: They carried a deadly fungus that caused the extinction of multiple frog species.

options.label: D
options.text: They were used in scientific research.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the fungus that can cause an infection that lethally disrupts the functioning of amphibian skin?

options.label: A
options.text: Chytrid

options.label: B
options.text: Fungal infection

options.label: C
options.text: Amphibian disease

options.label: D
options.text: Skin fungus

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the benefits and drawbacks of using African clawed frogs in scientific research?

options.label: A
options.text: Benefits: They are easy to use, respond quickly to hCG, and can be used in numerous tests. Drawbacks: They can escape and outcompete native amphibians, carry a deadly fungus, and are now classified as an invasive species.

options.label: B
options.text: Benefits: They are abundant in their native habitat, easy to catch and export, and can be used in numerous tests. Drawbacks: They can escape and outcompete native amphibians, carry a deadly fungus, and are now classified as an invasive species.

options.label: C
options.text: Benefits: They are easy to use, respond quickly to hCG, and can be used in numerous tests. Drawbacks: They are overhunted in the wild, carry a deadly fungus, and are now classified as an invasive species.

options.label: D
options.text: Benefits: They are abundant in their native habitat, easy to catch and export, and can be used in numerous tests. Drawbacks: They are overhunted in the wild, carry a deadly fungus, and are now classified as an invasive species.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the reasons why African clawed frogs were used in biological studies aboard the Space Shuttle Endeavour?

options.label: A
options.text: They were easy to use in space.

options.label: B
options.text: They were abundant in their native habitat.

options.label: C
options.text: They were able to adapt to microgravity environments.

options.label: D
options.text: They were used as a model for developmental biology.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the region of the frog's brain that was researched by Hillel Shapiro, Harry Zwarenstein, and Lancelot Hogben?

options.label: A
options.text: Pituitary gland

options.label: B
options.text: Brain region

options.label: C
options.text: Frog brain

options.label: D
options.text: Endocrine system

title: Why is this black square famous? - Allison Leigh

multiple-choice.question: Who is the artist behind the painting "Black Square"?

options.label: A
options.text: Kazimir Malevich

options.label: B
options.text: Vladimir Lenin

options.label: C
options.text: Leon Trotsky

options.label: D
options.text: Joseph Stalin

multiple-choice.question: What style of art did Malevich name, where feeling alone was made supreme?

options.label: A
options.text: Impressionism

options.label: B
options.text: Post-Impressionism

options.label: C
options.text: Futurism

options.label: D
options.text: Suprematism

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Malevich's departure from the world of objects, which he called non-objectivity?

options.label: A
options.text: A style that was still focused on depicting real-world objects

options.label: B
options.text: A style that went beyond abstraction, focusing on feeling alone

options.label: C
options.text: A style that was deemed unproductive to the Communist state

options.label: D
options.text: A new style of art that emphasized the artist believed was truly new

multiple-choice.question: What was removed as it is a duplicate of question 3

options.label: A
options.text: Socialist Realism

options.label: B
options.text: Suprematism

options.label: C
options.text: Abstract art

options.label: D
options.text: Impressionism

options.label: A
options.text: The figures gained more detail and realism

options.label: B
options.text: The backgrounds became more vibrant and colorful

options.label: C
options.text: The figures lost their arms and faces, and disintegrated as mechanization gripped the countryside

options.label: D
options.text: The paintings became more figurative

options.label: A
options.text: It represented a return to figuration

options.label: B
options.text: It symbolized a man who suffered through wars and revolutions, and continued to create art that was true to himself

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a surge in his artistic output

options.label: B
options.text: It resulted in a decline in his artistic output

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on his art or career

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Perfectly square

options.label: C
options.text: Centered on the canvas

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Futurism

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is a consequence of the extinction of megalodons on the marine ecosystem?

options.label: A
options.text: The number of marine mammals decreased

options.label: B
options.text: The number of marine megafauna increased

options.label: C
options.text: The nutrient transport between different ecosystems was disrupted

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: They had access to more food resources

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They were more competitive with other predators

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The impact of climate change on ecosystems

options.label: C
